poem:
Title: An Elegy for Unity Unfunded 

An edifice to common faith dismantled,
Expectant silence where voices once mingled.
37 venerated years 'twixt steeples, minarets, 
Yet unity unfunded is unity evicted.
"Mindful to withdraw," – a hollow phrase, 
Betrays more than the loss of sterling allocated,
'Tis the fading echo of love's language, 
In the corridors of power, lesser agitated.
